titleStmt.title: Thomas Laughery et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4447

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency
Thos E Bramlett
Governor of Kentucky

W. P. Adcock would State that at the March term of the Trimble Circuit Court he was indicted in three cases. for selling liquor to young men under the age of twenty one years. Mr Adcock And was fined one hundred and fifty dollars (fifty dollars in each case) Said fine was obtained at the October term of the Trimble Circuit Court. Mr Adcocks Says that he was wholly ignorant of the law, and had no thought that he was violating the law, and being advised that he had violated the law he at once plead guilty, trusting for the exercise of Executive clemency in his behalf. We your petioners would respectfully ask that Said fines be remitted or as much thereof as, as in your power So to do.

Thos Langhery
James W. Cranch
James L Wheeler
J. Connell
A. Burndt
John W. Stewart
John Hunter
W F Peak
G W Harmon
T M McCarty
Thomas oberan
T. B. Gatewood
J A Gouders
Daniel Damens
W. W. Orha
Thos A Mitchell
A. J. Wright
